meaningMnemonic: Think about Japan. Japan is a country made up of islands. They're basically three <radical>drop</radical> <radical>drop</radical> <radical>drop</radical>s in the large <radical>river</radical> that is the Pacific Ocean. These are Japan's <kanji>states</kanji> or <kanji>province</kanji>s.
readingMnemonic: Each <kanji>state</kanji> has its own <reading>shoe</reading> (しゅう) to represent it. The bottom of each shoe is the shape of the state, so when you step it leaves a state-shaped imprint in the ground.
